languageKey.label: Questionaire system for TYPO3.
Add questions, pagebreaks, conditions or presentation items to the questionaire.
tx_pbsurvey_results
Hide item from display in the questionaire.
Setting this option is practical while testing the questionaire. Do not change this option in a questionaire that is already online. It will influence the reliability of the results.
Select the system language of this element. Notice: This will affect whether the element is visible.

This allows you to assign a specific language to the question type. If you select anything but the "All" value, the element will not be visible unless the language assigned is also configured by the TypoScript template. The available system languages are created by the administrator.. Note: To get reliable results of a multiple language survey, you must translate all items in this survey.
Choose from over 20 item types, including four kinds of matrix questions, ranking questions, drop-down lists, open-ended text boxes, checkboxes, and more.
Use this field to enter the text for your question or input prompt.
Enter alternate text for use in the reports. If blank, the actual question will be displayed.
Enter informational or additional text to display below the question.
Check this box if an answer to this question is required.
Check this box if the answers to this question should be displayed in random order.
Select the way answers should be aligned on the page.
Enter the minimum number of fields that must be answered.
Enter the maximum number of fields that can be answered.
Enter the width, in pixels, of the column for the row headings.
Enter each row name on a separate line below.
The textbox below will show the answers each on a new line. Click the "wizard"-button to enter new answers and its options.
Check this box if you would like an additional "Other" answer to allow questionaire takers to give a different answer.
You may edit the text of the "Other" prompt in the text box below.
Select the type of control that should be used to for the additional answer.
Defines the width (cols) for the additional textarea.
Defines the height (rows) for the additional textarea.
Select the format for the response to the question.
This value will be selected as the default for this question.
This value will be selected as the default for this question.
When checked the negative value (false/no) will be first in order of the answer list.
The value entered below will be displayed as the default for this question.
The date entered below will be the default value. Format for the date is dd-mm-yyyy.
The value entered below will be displayed as the default for this question.
Enter the first number for the rating scale.
Enter the last number for the rating scale.
Enter the total that the value must add up to. To allow any total, leave this field blank.
Enter the earliest acceptable date. Format for the date is dd-mm-yyyy.
Enter the latest acceptable date. Format for the date is dd-mm-yyyy.
Enter the smallest acceptable numeric value.
Enter the largest acceptable numeric value.
Enter the maximum number of allowable characters for this question.
Here you can assign an image that will be shown in the questionaire.
To change the height of the image, enter a value below.
To change the width of the image, enter a value below.
Select the horizontal alignment for how the image should be displayed.
The SQL must contain two columns aliased as ItemValue and ItemDisplay.
Check this box if the answer to this question must be a valid email address.
Enter the text for the heading.
Use this field to enter any HTML and/or content. Text will be displayed using the HTML tags you enter.
Enter the text for the message.
Enter a CSS classname to add to the fieldset of this item.
Enter a optional page title.
Enter an optional page introduction.
Click the "Wizard" button to enter conditions.

Page conditions in the same group are evaluated together with an AND operator. Each group is evaluated with other groups using an OR operator. To evaluate all page conditions, use a single group.
Create a page condition by selecting a question from a prior page, and then specifying the operator and answer in the wizardform. Note that the Provided and Did Not Provide operators do not require an answer.
